title: Coordinating Conjunctions: Connecting Ideas
objectives: Understand Conjunctions Coordinating at Beginner level
Apply Conjunctions Coordinating in real conversations

vocabulary.definition: Connects two similar ideas. Example: I like tea and coffee.
Shows contrast. Example: I want to go, but I am tired.
Provides options. Example: Do you want coffee or tea?
Indicates result. Example: It was cold, so I wore a coat.
Shows contrast; similar to but. Example: It was late, yet I stayed out.

content.introduction: Welcome to this lesson on Conjunctions Coordinating.
content.explanation: In this lesson, you will learn about Conjunctions Coordinating at the Beginner level.
tips: Practice Conjunctions Coordinating daily for best results.

exercises.question: Choose the correct conjunction: I like apples ____ bananas.
She was tired, ____ she kept working.
Combine these two sentences: I am hungry. I will eat.

culturalNote: Using coordinating conjunctions is common in American speech and writing, helping connect ideas smoothly and naturally.
